title: How to correct the following sentence, “He do not run fast.” - Quora

response.answer_text: We use do with personal pronouns (you, we, they) and with plural noun forms. Does is used with third-person singular pronouns (he, she, it) and with singular noun forms. He is a third-person singular pronoun. Therefore, the correct form of the sentence is - “He does not run fast.”

Do :- We use do when the subject is I, you, we or they. Does :- We use does with third person singular pronouns i.e when the subject is he, she or it. So, correct sentence here is - He does not run fast.
